intro: Globba chekiangensis, commonly known as the Chinese globba, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features upright, narrow leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to moist, shaded environments. Globba chekiangensis is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its potential health benefits.
